p: White mustard is native to the Mediterranean region, where it is adapted to the climatic conditions, and it has great potential as a native source for biodiesel production. Because it contains much higher erucic acid levels than rapeseed, its oil is unsuitable for human consumption [ 26]. Thus, these two crops do not overlap in space or cultivation purpose, since white mustard crops are not oriented for the agro-alimentary oil market and are almost exclusively used for biofuel and mustard production.
